result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:00 PM Defendant DEBRA A HOLCOMB in court, in custody.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Barbara Pierce in court for DEBRA A HOLCOMB. Statement by Atty Pierce regarding bond modification. Statement by TF - alleged victim. Statement by Teresa Theis. Statement by ADA McElroy regarding bond. Court will amend bond to $5,000 cash bond and all other conditions are to remain the same.

Court adjourned at 2:03 PM

for Amendment of Bond - Defendant's

9:34 AM Defendant DEBRA A HOLCOMB in court, in custody.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Barbara Pierce in court for DEBRA A HOLCOMB. Atty Pierce states the defendant will waive the prelim. Defendant concurs. Court instructs the defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary examination. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause. Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files an information with the court, same as the criminal complaint and copy to Atty Pierce. Attorney Pierce acknowledges receipt of the information and waives any reading. Atty Pierce enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. 

Atty Pierce states the defendant would like to be heard and states reasons. DA Laspisa states she would not like to proceed due to victim notification. 

Court will set for Return Date on September 19, 2022 at 9:30 AM.

Court adjourned at 9:39 AM
Return date scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Return date on September 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:54 AM Defendant DEBRA A HOLCOMB in court, in custody.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant states she does not have an attorney yet, no one has been appointed. Court will see if we can find an attorney, will contact the PDs office first. 

Court adjourned at 10:55 AM
Second appearance on May 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report (Defendant is eligible for SPD - no attorney at this time.)

10:07 AM Defendant DEBRA A HOLCOMB in court, in custody.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Def qualifies for the public defender but does not yet have counsel. Court sets Status of Counsel for May 31, 2022 at5 10:30 am. If the def is still in custody and does not have an attorney, Court may look at appointing one for her. Statement by the defendant. 

Court adjourned at 10:08 AM.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report - No counsel appointed at this time.
Second appearance on April 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.

NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant DEBRA A HOLCOMB in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Def states she's been trying to contact the public defender's office with no success. Court schedules Status of Counsel April 26, 2022 at 10:00 AM. Court states he will look at a court appointed attorney if the public defender hasn't appointed someone for her by that time.
Second appearance on March 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:50 AM Defendant DEBRA A HOLCOMB appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Def has no objection to holding this hearing by zoom. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney. Court notes bond has been set. Statement by DA Laspisa - DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights. Statement by the def regarding bond. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant waives the time limits. Def states she does qualify for the public defender. Court goes over def's right to counsel and how to obtain one. Court will set for Status of Counsel on March 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Court adjourned at 9:55 AM.

Defendant Debra A. Holcomb appeared in court, Attorney Gerise Laspisa appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Court has reviewed a probable cause statement.  Statement by DA Laspisa - has not made contact with the victim as the victim is in the hospital. DA makes bond recommendation. Statement by the def. Court orders bond at $10,000 cash bond and conditions of: No Contact with the victim or victim's residence. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision. Defendant may go to the residence of the victim one time to obtain personal property that is needed for a few days (clothes, hygiene, medication, etc), but only under the supervision of a law enforcement officer.
